sections.title: Declaring and Initializing Multiple Servos
sections.content: Many FTC mechanisms require more than one servo. You can declare and initialize multiple servos in your OpMode by giving each a unique name in the hardware map.

sections.title: Example: Initializing Two Servos
sections.content: This code shows how to declare and initialize two servos in your OpMode.

sections.title: Coordinating Servo Movements
sections.content: To move two servos together (e.g., for a claw), set their positions in the same loop. You can use variables or constants to keep their movement synchronized.

sections.title: Synchronized Claw Example
sections.content: This code opens and closes a claw by moving two servos in opposite directions.

sections.title: Avoiding Power Issues with Multiple Servos
sections.content: Moving several servos at once can cause voltage drops. Stagger movements if possible, and monitor battery voltage with telemetry.

sections.title: Troubleshooting Multiple Servo Setups
sections.content: If one or more servos are not moving as expected, check hardware map names, wiring, and code logic. Use telemetry to verify servo positions.
